column4: can anyone tell me how to make lame encode a whole directory of .wav to mp3?
how do you make it encode one file?
lame sound.wav sound.mp3
so:  for i in *.wav; do lame "$i" "$(echo "$i" | sed 's/.wav$/.mp3/'); done
I missed a close quote:
so:  for i in *.wav; do lame "$i" "$(echo "$i" | sed 's/.wav$/.mp3/')"; done
sorry, I don't follow. I was trying lame ./*.wav *.mp3 but that didn't work.
copy and paste:
for i in *.wav; do lame "$i" "$(echo "$i" | sed 's/.wav$/.mp3/')"; done
woa, cool
can I copy that into a #bash script and just run it??
you can run that directly from the command line if you like
or you can make an alias or shell function from it

yes plz (:
copy and paste the whole of http://pastebin.ubuntulinux.nl/4522 into your .bashrc
then in any new shell you start, you'll be able to just type "wav2mp3" to convert wavs to mp3s recursively
